root.name: In the Groove
root.description: Gameplay In the Groove or "ITG" is the first dancing game from the company Roxors. With a very impressive songlist this became a hit in the western "Arcade dance" culture.ITG plays almost exactly like Konamis popular dancing franchise DDR, 4 different arrows (left, up, down and right) fly across the screen and you have to match these arrows by pressing on the correspondent arrow on the pad with your feet. There are four different difficulty levels, Easy, Medium, Hard and Expert and there is also a number for each difficulty level of the song that indicates how hard that song is at that particular level. The numbers goes from one to 13 were one is the easiest and 13 is the hardest. As the number goes up the stepcharts becomes trickier and there will be ofcourse, more arrows!For every arrow you press down on you will be judged on what timing you had on that single arrow. The grades go like this, from bad to good:MissWay offDecentGreatExcellentFantasticAnd by the end of the song you will be given your complete score in the form of percent, where 100% is all Fantastics.
